Description: Neck and shoulder fragment from East Greek pottery oinochoe or amphora; glaze fired orange-red; interior glazed; exterior, slipped white: panel on neck bounded by single band; metopal design, uncertain motif to left, maeander to its right, crossed rectangle to right beside handle area.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 227, no. 131)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 113, pl. XXXV, no. 324.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.151)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4716 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
